The 92-year-old head of state welcomed the rest of the royal family to her annal pre-Christmas lunch at Buckingham Palace today. The Queen hosts a big feast every year so she can catch up with everyone before she retreats to Sandringham for the rest of the winter period. She always spends the first part of every year in Norfolk and doesn't return to London until after the anniversary of her father's death on February 6, 1952.

Princess Charlotte looks cute as she joins Kate for Christmas lunch

When will the Queen take the train to Sandringham at Christmas?



An official date has not been released for when the Queen will catch the train to her Christmas hideout this year.



But she is known to travel on a regular commuter train to and from Norfolk every year.



The Queen typically arrives in King’s Lynn station, after travelling from London King’s Cross at around 10.45am, along with her royal entourage.
title: Queen and Prince Philip: When will the Queen take the train to Sandringham at Christmas?
